intro: Quararibea pendula, commonly known as the hanging quina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its drooping clusters of yellow flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often found in moist, shady habitats in the Amazon rainforest. Quararibea pendula is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine.
